alert.note: Alert for St. Charles (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 12:38PM CDT until August 28 at 7:40AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, St. Charles and St. John The Baptist. * WHEN...Until 345 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1238 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Hahnville, Avondale, Metairie, Laplace, Marrero, Harvey, Reserve, Jefferson, Harahan, Westwego, Luling, Ama, St. Rose, Destrehan, Boutte, New Sarpy, Waggaman, Norco and River Ridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
